alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:37PM PST until December 07 at 9:28AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .Heavy rain is over but flood waters continue to make their way down rivers and streams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Skagit River near Mt. Vernon. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, the Skagit River will cause minor flooding from Sedro Woolley downstream through Mount Vernon to the mouth... with shallow flooding in low pasture lands and over a few low-lying roads near the river. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 3 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 29.4 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 PM PST Wednesday was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river crested this afternoon near 29.5 feet and is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 545 PM PST.
